New Records: Son Heung-Min scored a hat-trick as South Korea handed China a 3-0 defeat in Shenzhen on Tuesday to complete back-to-back wins at the start of their challenge for a place at the 2026 World Cup finals.
Key Match Events: Son Heung-Min scored twice and set up the third as South Korea handed China a 3-0 defeat in Shenzhen on Tuesday
Son put the Koreans in front in the Group C clash in the second phase of Asia's preliminaries with an 11th minute penalty after Hwang Hee-chan had been fouled in the area
He added the second in the final minute of the first half with a header that looped over Yan from the edge of the six-yard box following Lee Kang-in's corner
The Tottenham Hotspur forward turned provider three minutes from time when he drifted in a free kick from the right that Jung Seung-hyun headed past Yan to put the seal on the victory
Pre-Game Insights: The game was played in Kuwait due to the Israel-Hamas war.
Australia and Palestine players stood for a minute's silence ahead of their game.
Post-Match Reflections: The win keeps South Korea perfect after the first two games in the second round of Asia's preliminaries for the 2026 World Cup.
The Thais bounced back from that loss to beat Singapore 3-1 with Suphanat Mueanta scoring twice in the second half for Mano Polking's team, who move level with China on three points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The qualifying games will resume in March next year.
Kuwait trounced Afghanistan 4-0 away to move into second place in Group A behind Qatar.
United Arab Emirates maintained a perfect record in Group H with a 2-0 victory over Bahrain.
